cards.front: When was Blue Öyster Cult formed, and where?
cards.back: Blue Öyster Cult was formed in 1967 in Long Island, New York.

cards.front: What was Blue Öyster Cult's original name?
cards.back: The band's original name was Soft White Underbelly.

cards.front: Name the first studio album released by Blue Öyster Cult and its release year.
cards.back: Their first studio album is 'Blue Öyster Cult', released in 1972.

cards.front: Which Blue Öyster Cult album contains the hit song '(Don't Fear) The Reaper'?
cards.back: '(Don't Fear) The Reaper' is found on the 'Agents of Fortune' album, released in 1976.

cards.front: What is the title of the Blue Öyster Cult song that received significant attention due to its mention of Godzilla?
cards.back: The song is titled 'Godzilla', from the album 'Spectres' released in 1977.

cards.front: How many studio albums has Blue Öyster Cult released as of 2023?
cards.back: As of 2023, Blue Öyster Cult has released 15 studio albums.

cards.front: What distinguishes Blue Öyster Cult's music and image from other hard rock bands of their time?
cards.back: Blue Öyster Cult is known for their use of symbolism, especially the hook-and-cross logo, their sophisticated lyrics, and an interest in themes like science fiction and horror, distinguishing them from other hard rock bands.

cards.front: Name a Blue Öyster Cult album released in the 21st century.
cards.back: One of their 21st-century albums is 'The Symbol Remains', released in 2020.
